data.description: Silent Operations is a fun and immersive first person VR shooter that allows you to clear compounds, find Intel, and defend areas from raids of enemies. You have multiple pistols that can be unlocked that offer different advantages over others. Grab yourself a pistol with a silencer and take out various enemies quietly and quickly or go guns blazing!

changelog.change_log:
- Added BÃ©zier curve and a sphere to identify where player will move/teleport to. Curve goes away ones the destination gets close to the player do de-clutter the screen, however the sphere remains.
- Added time to reload so that player cannot shoot while reload sounds are still playing.

- Player input for menus is now inputted by pulling the trigger on UI buttons rather than the  non user friendly left and right with the touchpad. This appears to be a lot more user friendly for navigating through in-game menus.

- Settings menu added with options to change movement from touchpad to teleportation. Various other menus have changes as well.

- Option to use teleportation movement rather than touchpad.

- In-game HUD removed for a more immersive experience.

The goal of this update was to make the game more user friendly and I think I have achieved that goal.

- When the player has backed out of all menus and is not in a mission (exit via pause menu) and has pressed the back button down player is sent to confirm quit menu.

- Left handed play has been added. When player pauses the game with the Oculus Home button and changes handedness to left or right the game automatically updates the players handedness upon resuming the application.

- Entitlement check code has been added per: https://developer.oculus.com/blog/unity-engine-entitlement-checks-for-gear-vr-and-rift/.
- Added giving player in-game currency when completing missions.
